bioghist.p: Henry Smith Leiper (1891-1975) was Executive Secretary of the Federal Council of Churches. He received his B.D. from Union Theological Seminary and his Master's degree from Columbia University. After serving as a missionary for the American Board of Commissioners for Foreign Missions (ABCFM) from 1918 to 1922, Leiper served as administrator in numerous ecumenical organizations, including the ABCFM, the Federal Council of Churches, the American Church in Paris, and the World Council of Churches.

scopecontent.p: This collection includes minutes of the Congregational and Christian Churches, 1945-1949; minutes of the World Council of Churches and minutes of the Cabinet of the Missions Council (of the Congregational and Christian Churches), 1913-1950; subject files, 1932-1969; Leiper's correspondence, 1917-1970; books and publications written by Leiper and others; correspondence and manuscript drafts, 1980-1985, for a book about Leiper written by William J. Schmidt and Edward Ouellette; a manuscript of Sherwood Eddy's book You Will Never Die; materials on Leiper's service in China, 1918; materials on his official travels in Europe during the 1930s and 1940s; sermons, addresses, and manuscripts for articles; clippings; photographs; school notes and exams; and published materials, including books, magazines, pamphlets, and bibles and a hymnal.
